text: Christiane Jentsch (born July 13, 1961; in marriage was known as Christiane Scheibel) is a former German curler. She won a gold medal at the 1992 Winter Olympics when curling was a demonstration sportOfficial Report 1992W page 630 - Olympic Official Reports Collection and also won the . She was skip of women's team of Curling Club Füssen in 1980-1984 and 1994-2001. In seasons 1985/1986 and 1991/1992 she played in Andrea Schöpp's team out of SC Riessersee (Garmisch-Partenkirchen). Christiane Jentsch retired from competitive curling in 2002. ==Teams== {| class="wikitable" |- ! scope="col"| Season ! scope="col"| Skip ! scope="col"| Third ! scope="col"| Second ! scope="col"| Lead ! scope="col"| Alternate ! scope="col"| Events |- ! scope="row"| 1984–85 | Andrea Schöpp || Monika Wagner || Christiane Jentsch || Elinore Schöpp || || (5th) |- ! scope="row"| 1991–92 | Andrea Schöpp || Stephanie Mayr || Monika Wagner || Sabine Huth || Christiane Scheibel (OG) || OG 1992 (demo) |- ! scope="row"| 1992–93 | Andrea Schöpp || Monika Wagner || Stephanie Mayr || Christiane Scheibel || || |} ==References== ==External links== * *CYRUS MAKOWSKI · Lawyers · Hamburg · Berlin | Dr. Christiane Jentsch Category:Living people Category:1961 births Category:German female curlers Category:Curlers at the 1992 Winter Olympics Category:Olympic curlers of Germany Category:European curling champions Category:Place of birth missing (living people)
